alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:23PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A cluster of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Hidalgo, northwestern Cameron and southwestern Willacy Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1221 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over western Cameron County, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Harlingen, San Benito, Mercedes, La Feria, Elsa, Edcouch, Santa Rosa, Lyford, La Villa and Palm Valley. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 15 and 44. US Highway 281 between mile markers 808 and 830. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Inland Cameron; Inland Willacy; Southern Hidalgo
